intro: Stizolophus balsamita, commonly known as Balsamita, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Balsamita is also valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
